title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Pine Street Inn outreach teams canvassed Boston with supplies during a blizzard, aiming to shelter homeless individuals.
Outreach saw about 50 people outside overnight; fewer were on streets, indicating many opted for shelter.
Boston shelters operated beyond capacity during the storm; upwards of 660 people were accommodated with extra cots.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: 50% of flights from Boston Logan Airport canceled on Tuesday due to a nor'easter affecting New England.
Amtrak suspended service between Boston and New York, with efforts to resume by Tuesday morning pending conditions.
Nearly 1,000 flights were canceled Monday, and travelers advised to check with airlines for Tuesday's potential disruptions.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins face decision on trading Viktor Arvidsson before NHL trade deadline with team's playoff prospects in balance.
Arvidsson has 14 goals, 28 points in 45 games, strengthening his trade value and Bruins' playoff chances.
Keeping Arvidsson might sustain playoff push, but trading him could benefit long-term asset management.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Over 30 inches of snow in Massachusetts leads to school closures on Feb. 24, affecting numerous districts.
Boston and surrounding areas report widespread school closures, including major districts like Cambridge and Worcester.
Several schools, such as Athol-Royalston and Littleton, experience delays rather than complete closures due to the snow storm.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown recalled his initial dislike of coach Mike Vrabel, writing 'I hate Vrabel' in his notebook during team meetings.
Brown's perspective changed over time, recognizing Vrabel's accountability and commitment to team standards as critical development influences.
Speculation suggests Brown as a trade candidate for the Patriots, despite currently being contracted with the Eagles.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The US women's hockey team declined President Trump's State of the Union invitation citing academic and professional commitments.
The women's team won gold against Canada; the men’s team, also victorious against Canada, was invited by Trump.
NHL's schedule resumes, conflicting with players attending Trump's events; USA men’s players are expected at State of the Union.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots released 27-year-old running back Antonio Gibson, freeing up over $3 million in salary cap space.
Gibson, recovering from a torn ACL, contributed as a reliable third-down back and kick returner for the Patriots.
Gibson participated in 22 games, achieving 644 rushing yards, 212 receiving yards, and 581 kick return yards with one touchdown.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, impacting areas like Boston and Providence.
Blizzard conditions require visibility under 1/4 mile for three hours, with winds of 35 mph or more.
The National Weather Service warned of hazardous travel, whiteout conditions, and possible power outages.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Blizzard conditions hit downtown Boston as a nor'easter brings heavy snow and strong winds to the region.
Photographer Jack Coen captures near-whiteout conditions and fierce wind gusts outside Boston's Old State House.
National Weather Service forecasts up to 24 inches of snow and damaging winds, advising caution against whiteout conditions.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton wants to hit Tom Brady with an RKO after Brady's remarks on WWE during Logan Paul's podcast.
Tom Brady and Logan Paul exchanged banter about their upcoming Fanatics Flag Football Classic, with Brady mocking WWE's athleticism.
Brady is set to play in the flag football event alongside NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Christian McCaffrey.
